transcript: What brings you in? I just came in because I just got into like this incident while I was playing Rugby I Kind of got tackled and then fell onto my right shoulder After I got up I I've been I've just been this had just happened a couple hours ago actually and I've just been in tense pain in my right shoulder and it can't seem to move it at all Okay, and sorry one was this exactly? Probably two hours ago two hours ago, okay And is this pain persistent or is it like on and off? It's it's constant it hasn't gone away at all One to ten ten being the worst how bad is this pain? I don't know like probably like eight or eight or nine eight or nine, okay um, and is it a sharp kind of pain or is it dull at all? It's it's sharp like if I try to move it at all. It's like a sharp pain. Okay And have you ever had anything like this in the past? No, never never okay, and are you able to move your arm at all or? You can't move it I could move my fingers and hand and elbow but elbow a little bit, but like I yeah, I can't move my shoulder whatsoever Um and do you are you experiencing any tingling on of this? Um No, I don't think so Have of any In that area, I don't know if it's weakness or pain, but yeah, I just can't move it uh and I do feel some Like numbness just on above my shoulder. No tingling though Okay, any pain elsewhere in your body? No Any headaches No, confusion or memory loss Uh, no Weight loss No, fingers are chauve no rashes No, uh change in your vision hearing smell or taste Uh, nope coughing sharp as a breath or breathing Uh, nope just pain or heart palpitations Oh changes in your bowel movements. No changes in boiling No um, okay, and then with regards to this pain does anything make it better or worse? Um Um, not anything that I've tried that to make it better Worse is probably just if I try to move it at all Okay, and the pain's in your shoulder. Does it radiate down or up elsewhere? Uh, mostly towards my shoulder um kind of Down Towards my upper arm as well Okay, let's see Um, all right, and um, are you otherwise healthy? Do you have any other medical conditions? No, yeah, otherwise I'm healthy. I've never been Uh, to the doctor much Okay All right, um And are you on any medications? No No, okay And um, are you up to date with your immunizations? Yes Okay, um, do you have any allergies? Uh, nope Any family history of musculoskeletal diseases? No, not that I know Okay And any family history of autoimmune conditions? Um, no Okay Um, do you smoke at all? Uh, nope No, um, do you consume marijuana? Uh, nope Do you drink alcohol? Uh, no, uh, just just with friends sometimes on the weekends, then not really Okay Um, and then Where do you live right now and who do you live with? Uh, I live, uh, just outside of town with my parents in a house Okay And um, have you traveled anywhere recently? Um, no, I've been at home Okay, any sick contacts? No No, okay, so now we're just going to move on to the physical exam part of this And so can you take a look at both your shoulders and let me know if you see any redness or swelling? Um, I don't think I see any redness or swelling, but um My right shoulder and my arm just seems a little bit lower than my left arm Okay Okay, okay Any um, warmth on, on that shoulder? Uh, no, not that I can feel Okay, any atrophy deformities or skin changes? Um, Formity, I do feel like kind of uh Like my shoulders dropped and like there's just kind of this uh Little like divots uh, where like the shoulders should be Okay, okay, and can you palpate that area for me just um, the bones in that area? So like right where your arm would connect to your shoulder and then kind of along your shoulder blade Does that hurt when you press down? Yeah, I hurt a lot Okay, so some tenderness and pain in the uh, chromine process and scapula um and If you press down on your biceps triceps does that hurt? Not as much, no no, okay, and then can I get you to um Can you lift your shoulder up at all like to where to the point where your fingers are? Touch like uh reaching the ceiling No, I can't I can't Okay, all right So um it sounds like you have a shoulder dislocation um, so we are going to Do an extra to your shoulder joint first to um Make sure um that it's it's just a dislocation and there aren't any broken bones or fractures and then um We can resolve this by doing something called a closed reduction um to try to put the joint back in its place um And if that's closed reduction doesn't work then You may need surgery for like um a weak shoulder joint or like ligaments um Aren't like strong enough um and it continues to happen Okay Otherwise we can Keep it immobilized for a few days to a few weeks um Depending on how bad the dislocation is um and then once that's removed you can Do some rehab as well to restore some range of motion Does that sound like a good plan? Do you have any questions or concerns in the meantime? Uh, no, I think that's uh that's great Okay
